title: Corporate Governance Practices of Blackstone Inc

content.text: Blackstone Inc has a diverse and experienced board of directors. The board consists of 11 members, including both internal and external directors. The independent directors make up the majority of the board, ensuring a balanced representation of interests. The directors possess relevant expertise in areas such as finance, investments, and risk management, which aligns with the company's core business activities. The board members also serve on various committees, such as Audit, Compensation, and Nominating Committees, enhancing the effectiveness of oversight and decision-making processes.

Blackstone Inc has a transparent and performance-based approach to executive compensation. The compensation of top executives is influenced by the company's financial performance and achievement of predetermined metrics. A significant portion of executive compensation is tied to long-term performance and equity ownership, which aligns executive interests with those of shareholders. The company clearly discloses the components of executive compensation and provides details on the performance metrics used. This transparency ensures accountability and promotes alignment between executives and shareholders.
